subject: Re: [junit] Is Junit-based testing REALLY possible for commercial software development ?
msgSnippet: ...  You weren t thinking of anyone in particular, were you? ... It s not a URL, but have you read Astels TDD: A Practical Guide? -- J. B. (Joe)
messageBody:
Robert Lucente wrote:

> Hiring consultants that bills by the author falls into this category.

<ahem> You weren't thinking of anyone in particular, were you?

> I realize that the following question does not belong in the JUnit mailing
> list. However, request the favor of a quick indulgence. Would you be willing
> to share some url's that talk about testing Swing apps ?

It's not a URL, but have you read Astels' TDD: A Practical Guide?
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
